content_blocks.text: Inteli Scholarship Program
At the college of the future, support the best talents in Brazil.
content_blocks.subsection: At the college of the future, support the best talents in Brazil.

content_blocks.text: I'm very proud to say that we have created the largest scholarship program in Brazil, with 50% of our students receiving full scholarships, as well as aid for housing, meals, English classes, transportation and a laptop. That's because we believe in creating opportunities for the best talent in Brazil and we reinforce our commitment toexcellence.

Co-founder of Inteli

content_blocks.text: "At Inteli I found a community that values every individual and strives to train leaders who can positively impact society. I identified my passion for solving problems through technology and embraced the mission of democratizing education, especially for women. Inteli has provided me with a space to dream big and a community that supports and celebrates the journey of turning dreams into reality."

Types of donation

The creation of the scholarship program was only possible because we found donor-partners with the same dream of investing in the development of the country's future technology leaders. Since 2021, more than R$120 million has been donated to the scholarship fund, which shows the strength of the philanthropic spirit of individuals, companies and foundations in changing the reality of education in our country.
Adopt a student
Commitment to a student's complete education over the four years of their degree, including all the benefits.
Perpetual Scholarship
Commitment to the complete training of a student every 4 years, including all benefits, for life. Every 4 years a new student graduates with the value of this scholarship for life.
Scholarship Fund
A one-off donation for a specific benefit for one or more students over a given period.

In categories 1 and 2, donors follow the student's trajectory throughout the four years of their degree, receiving biannualreportsand taking part in our annual Donors' Breakfast event: a chance to meet other donors and catch up with their Scholars.
Our community of donors

Our community of donors includes influential names from various sectors who have committed themselves to Inteli's mission and make an impact by donating to Brazil's largest scholarship program. This community of donors is close-knit, meeting annually and following Inteli's growth and progress first-hand.

How does it work?

Scholarships are awarded for Inteli undergraduate courses. None of the resources and benefits offered by Inteli are refundable. This means that scholarship students do not incur any debt.We often hear from young people that they want to be able to contribute to the scholarship program in the future. In this way, they can continue to impact the lives of other talents and help shape new leaders to transform Brazil.
